page.title: 09FARMING continued
page.content: It too is a mixed farm which has a small flock of Teeswater sheep which are kept for breeding purposes. The sheep are pedigree and they are bred for {tup}lambs which are sold at around 8 months to a year old to be crossed with Swaledale & Masham sheep. The main income of the farm is from a large dairy herd of British Fresians. There are 180 cattle with 2 bulls, 77 cows and 101 calves. The male calves are sold for beef. The Robinsons also keep around 200 Warren henswhich are free range and the eggs are sold locally. Three Llamas are also kept, the female has just given birth to a female calf. Although both farms are mixed farms, each has a bias towards different aspects of farming. Both are self sufficient in hay,silage and grow enough corn for there own needs.
